Author: jkush
Content: You're right, of course. What I DO like about this is the fact that Obama (seems to) know enough to say that he needs someone to help his administration understand technology. I can't fault that at all.

Content: I didn't quite get that. Was he taking the piss out of Tim Bray for being older? No I don't find _why at all helpful, nor amusing. Some folk do though.

Content: Google search was probably seen as a feature rather than a company.  I don't know first hand though.

Author: ardit33
Content:
mkay... and Darpa and ARPAnet came from what again? ah, right goverment.

So, did the first computers (used in WW!!), etc. Nuclear power. Etc.

A good Goverment can do a good job and seeding and incubating technologies that might be intersting in the future (for the humankind), but they are not profitable or interesting to Companies, as they don't have a clear Roi.

Same with shutles and space. Goverement started space exploration, few decades from now, private companies will build on the knowledge amased thru all these years and create a space toursism industry (and make profits, and create thousands of jobs).

Author: jgrahamc
Content:
The thing about Xobni is that as much as I like it (having been doing interesting things with email for a very long time) and I think they are right to focus on Outlook (since it sux0r), I can't help thinking that Xobni is a _feature_ and not a company.

Perhaps the Xobni guys can talk about what makes them think that it's a stand alone company? Perhaps the answer is that they don't, perhaps they just hope Microsoft will buy them.

John.

Author: kajecounterhack
Content:
impressive....useful when I'm at school and don't have photoshop but need to crop/edit an image.

I doubt it can be used seriously for design though...still lacking too many features. I'm using Photoshop 7 and it still doesn't quite compare...

Author: champion
Content: Makes a lot of business sense, but doesn't help poor Gmail users whose Contacts app falls well short of the bar set by the rest of Gmail. Nice that it auto-adds contacts, but other than that it feels like a bastard stepchild feature to date.

Author: champion
Content: Yeah, good point, but _why's idiosyncratic writing is wacky fun.

Author: danielha
